oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Fatigue behavior of stiffener to cross beam joints in orthotropic steel decks
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Croce, Pietro
Pellegrini, Daniele
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Orthotropic steel bridge decks
Fatigue
Stiffener to cross beams joints
Cope hole
J-integral
Stress intensity factor
info:eu-repo/classification/acm/J.2 PHYSICAL SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In the paper the possibility to evaluate the fatigue strength of stiffener to cross beam joints in orthotropic steel decks is discussed. The proposed methodology, based on Paris-Erdogan law, allows to derive a sound estimate of the stress intensity factor K combining the indirect approach, based on the Rice J-integral, with the direct one, based on the extrapolation of experimental or numerical data. The practical implementation of the proposed methodology allowed to predict correctly the actual fatigue life of a previously tested real scale specimen, so validating its potentialities.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: In: Procedia Engineering, vol. 101 pp. 101 - 108. Special issue: 3rd International Conference on Material and Component Performance under Variable Amplitude Loading, VAL2015. Czech Society for Mechanics (ed.). Elsevier, 2015.
